articles.title: U.S. Korea policy termed policy of evil
articles.content:
U.S. Korea policy termed policy of evil 
    Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun today in a signed article terms the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK a policy of evil against the Korean nation, its reunification and peace, a policy which arouses the resentment of the Koreans and the world progressives.
 The U.S. policy toward the DPRK is a policy of aggression and a policy of war to stifle the DPRK and its basic goal is to strangle the DPRK by force, the article says, and goes on:    
 The U.S. strategy toward the DPRK is aimed to swallow up the DPRK and put the whole of Korea under its domination. 
 It is because of the U.S. hostile policy the two parties would grow stronger in the future, too, it wished the congress great success in its work.

Greetings to 7th Congress of NCP (UML)
articles.content:
Greetings to 7th Congress of NCP (UML)
    Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea sent a message of greetings to the 7th Congress of the Nepal Communist Party (United Marxist-Leninist) on Feb. 1.
 The message expressed belief that the congress will be a historic occasion in vigorously inspiring the party in the efforts to strengthen itself and promote the well-being of the people.    
 Convinced that the excellent friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties would grow stronger in the future, too, it wished the congress great success in its work.
